definition: variant of 翻[fan1]
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
foreign (non-Chinese)/barbarian/classifier for occurrences (of an event, action or speech utterance)/classifier for iterations: times, -fold (as in twofold etc)/classifier for situations: kind, sort
surname Pan
feather/5th note in pentatonic scale
to translate/to interpret/translator/interpreter/translation/interpretation/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
to overthrow
to open up
to double/to increase by a certain number of times
to revamp/a face-lift/to retread (a tire)/to refurbish (old clothes)/newly emerging
to turn over (when lying)/(fig.) to free oneself/to emancipate oneself/to bring about a change of one's fortunes
flip-top (mobile phone, handbag etc)/to rebuild/to renovate
to thumb through/to flip through (a book)
to cross/to surmount/to transcend
to reprint/reproduction/pirate copy/(fig.) imitation/carbon copy/clone
to turn over/to transform
sky and the earth turning upside down (idiom); fig. complete confusion/everything turned on its head
to roll/to boil
to double

sentences.english: We had been doing business with each other for years before we quarrelled.
sentences.chinese: 在吵翻之前，我们多年来在业务上一直来往。

sentences.english: Housing prices in Shanghai have doubled.The main index of the Shanghai stock exchange just passed 6,000 - up more than fivefold in two years.
sentences.chinese: 上海的房价已经翻了一倍。

sentences.english: Aguero in the heart a fiercely, flip phones photograph of her son.
sentences.chinese: 许仪心中一凛，翻出手机上儿子的照片。

sentences.english: She snooped through his things for his affairs.
sentences.chinese: 她把他的东西都翻了一遍，想要找他外遇的证据。

sentences.english: He finally rummaged out her reply in the middle drawer of his desk.
sentences.chinese: 他最后从写字台中间抽屉里翻找出她的复信。

sentences.english: My fantasy spills soup and gravy .
sentences.chinese: 由于我在胡思乱想，倒翻了菜汤和肉汁。

sentences.english: OK? So the example I'm going to do, I'm going to search a sorted list.
sentences.chinese: 来搜索目标元素，好，翻到课堂材料的第二页。

sentences.english: Her constant shuffling of newspapers disconcerted us.
sentences.chinese: 她不断地乱翻报纸使我们心神不定。

sentences.english: The Knave did so, very carefully, with one foot.
sentences.chinese: 武士用脚小心地把他们三个翻了过来。

sentences.english: Today, I went into my bathroom and saw that my trashcan had been pushed over.
sentences.chinese: 今天我上厕所，发现垃圾桶翻了。

sentences.english: The car turned over twice,left the road,and ploughed into the wall.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车翻了两下，离开了马路，猛撞到一堵墙上。

sentences.english: Gushan to have turned evil, never to month Begonia trouble.
sentences.chinese: 到得孤山翻作恶，海棠闹月不曾来。

sentences.english: The act of turning or winding or folding around a central axis .
sentences.chinese: 围绕一个中心轴翻或绕或叠的动作。

sentences.english: He threw a summersault on the bed.
sentences.chinese: 他在床上翻了一个筋斗。

sentences.english: The liner ran down a fishing-boat during the dense fog.
sentences.chinese: 在浓雾中，客轮撞翻了一条渔船。

sentences.english: The thieves had turned the house upside down looking for the papers.
sentences.chinese: 那些小偷们为了找寻那些文件而把屋子翻了个底朝天。
